document.docAuthor: Miller, Kelly B. & Wolfe, G. William
document.docTitle: Desmopachria gingerae Miller and Wolfe 2018, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Nine New Species in the Desmopachria nitida Species-Group of the Neotropical Genus Desmopachria Babington, 1841 (Coleoptera: Adephaga: Dytiscidae: Hydroporinae: Hyphydrini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Nine New Species in the Desmopachria nitida Species-Group of the Neotropical Genus Desmopachria Babington, 1841 (Coleoptera: Adephaga: Dytiscidae: Hydroporinae: Hyphydrini)

heading.emphasis:
Desmopachria gingerae Miller and Wolfe
, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Locality.
Venezuela , Amazonas , S Cummindad Porvenir , 5°20.514ʹ N , 67°45.315ʹ W
.

Diagnosis. This species differs from others in this group by the elongate, slender male median lobe. In lateral aspect, the lobe is broader medially but abruptly narrowed and apically slender and sinuate ( Fig. 9 ). In ventral aspect, it is moderately broad with the lateral margins broadly sinuate and the apex long and needle-like ( Fig. 10 ). The median lobe is somewhat similar to that of
Desmopachria vohrae Miller and Wolfe
, new species , but that species has the lateral margins less characteristically sinuate and the apex less needlelike and more distinctly bifid in ventral aspect ( Fig. 30 ). Coloration is moderately distinctive, head and pronotum dark orange and elytron lighter in color than head and pronotum, but with large, diffuse, medial blackish region. Specimens

caption.paragraph:
Table 1. KUNHM (University of Kansas) accession numbers for specimens of five
Desmopachria species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
D. delongi SEMC
1113363, SEMC1114787, SEMC1114807, SEMC1114823, SEMC1114830

Description. Measurements: TL = 1.4–1.5 mm , GW = 1.0– 1.1 mm , HW = 0.5–0.6 mm , EW = 0.3 mm , TL/GW = 1.2–1.4, HW/EW = 2.0–2.1. Coloration: Head and pronotum pale orange, posterior margin of pronotum medially narrowly brown-black. Elytron with base color orange-brown, lighter than head and pronotum, with broadly expanded diffuse blackish region medially near suture. Head appendages, legs, and ventral surfaces orangebrown. Male genitalia: Male median lobe in lateral aspect long and slender, apical portion sinuate, apex extremely slender and apically acute ( Fig. 9 ). Median lobe in ventral aspect moderately slender, lateral margins sinuate, convergent to long, slender, needle-like apex ( Fig. 10 ). Lateral lobe broad basally, apically deeply emarginate, ventral ramus elongate, slender, apically narrowly rounded, dorsal ramus elongate, slightly expanded medially, apically rounded ( Fig. 11 ); in ventral aspect slender, apices of rami rounded.
Variation. Elytron with diffusely lighter medial area. Most specimens have the head and pronotum darker than the base color of the elytra except the large, diffuse, medial region of the elytron.

Etymology. This species is named
gingerae
in honor of the second author’ s youngest daughter, Ginger Wolfe-Suarez.
Distribution. This species has been found only in a few localities in southwestern Venezuela ( Fig. 70 ).
Habitat. Label data indicate that specimens were collected from a “small streamlet,” a “rocky morichal,” “rock pools,” and a “pool in culvert.”

Type Material.
Holotype in MIZA , male labeled, “ VENEZUELA : Amazonas State 5°20.514ʹN ; 67°45.315ʹW ,
87m
S. Communidad Porvenir
15.i.2009
; leg. Miller & Short VZ09-0115-03B: small streamlet/ SEMC0852878 KUNHM-ENT [label with barcode]/ HOLOTYPE
Desmopachria gingerae Miller and Wolfe, 2017
[red label with black line border].”

Desmopachria gingerae Miller and Wolfe, 2017
[blue label with black line border];” 13 labeled “ VENEZUELA : Bolivar State 6°13ʹ4.6ʺN , 67°14ʹ26.4ʺW ,
60m
